summary: This is an email chain between federal prosecutors and law enforcement officials regarding the confirmation of receipt of documents related to an incident involving Jeffrey Epstein. It appears to be administrative coordination following Epstein's death in custody.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The recipient of an email confirming receipt of incident documents related to Epstein, asking for clarification if the documents are from just one incident.

events.title: Email Coordination on Epstein Incident Docs
events.description: Email exchange between an Assistant United States Attorney and other officials (OIG, FBI) confirming receipt of documents related to an incident involving Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: The document is an email chain dated August 13, 2019, concerning documents related to an incident involving Jeffrey Epstein.
An Assistant United States Attorney asks for clarification if the provided documents are from 'just 1 incident'.
The email involves coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS), the Office of the Inspector General (OIG), and the FBI.
The correspondence appears to be administrative follow-up, likely in the immediate aftermath of Epstein's death in custody on August 10, 2019.
